item.title: Socioeconomic Outlooks between Anglo and Franco-Canadians
item.description: Part I. Introduction First paragraph: The divide between English and French Canada has historically been the source of much social tension in this country. Franco-Canadians have historically found themselves in opposition to and oppressed by the English majority. Although in recent times, the tension between these two groups have cooled, the effects can still be seen within society. In particular, the socioeconomic well-being of these communities. The goal of this analysis is to that can be seen in contemporary Canadian society, as a result of these tensions.
